title: Black market (SpliceHack)
data:
The **Black market** in [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") is similar to the [black market](/wiki/Black_market_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Black market (SLASH'EM)") in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"). It offers many items for sale at inflated prices, and is guarded by [One-Eyed Sam](/wiki/One-Eyed_Sam "One-Eyed Sam") who is generated with [Thiefbane](/wiki/Thiefbane "Thiefbane"). The [magic portal](/wiki/Magic_portal "Magic portal") to the black market is between levels 20 and 25.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Map](#Map)

- [2 One-eyed Sam](#One-eyed_Sam)
  - [2.1 Angering One-eyed Sam](#Angering_One-eyed_Sam)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

  - [3.1 Shopping](#Shopping)
  - [3.2 Robbery](#Robbery)

- [4 See also](#See_also)

- [5 References](#References)

## Map

\----------------------------------------------------------------------------  
|[^](/wiki/Magic_portal "Magic portal")|........................................................................|  
|.|[&](/wiki/Pit_fiend "Pit fiend").......................................................................|  
|.|[T](/wiki/Rock_troll "Rock troll").......................................................................|  
|.|[&](/wiki/Balrog "Balrog").......................................................................|  
|.|........................................................................|  
|.|........................................................................|  
|.|........................................................................|  
|.|[9](/wiki/Marrashi "Marrashi").......................................................................|  
|.|[n](/wiki/Wood_nymph "Wood nymph").......................................................................|  
|.|........................................................................|  
|.|[:](/wiki/Salamander "Salamander").......................................................................|  
|.|[T](/wiki/Rock_troll "Rock troll").......................................................................|  
|.|[@](/wiki/Captain "Captain").......................................................................|  
|.[+](/wiki/Door "Door")........................................................................|  
|.|........................................................................|  
|.|[H](/wiki/Frost_giant "Frost giant").......................................................................|  
\----------------------------------------------------------------------------

The shop includes the entire level except the corridor on the left.

The assistants are the following ten monsters:

- A [rock troll](/wiki/Rock_troll "Rock troll") named William
- A [rock troll](/wiki/Rock_troll "Rock troll") named Thomas
- A [frost giant](/wiki/Frost_giant "Frost giant") named Goliath
- A [wood nymph](/wiki/Wood_nymph "Wood nymph") named Daphne
- A [balrog](/wiki/Balrog "Balrog") named Njalnohaar
- A [pit fiend](/wiki/Pit_fiend "Pit fiend") named Hilvuuloth
- A [captain](/wiki/Captain "Captain") named Kidd
- A [marrashi](/wiki/Marrashi "Marrashi") named Kite
- A [salamander](/wiki/Salamander "Salamander") named Izzy

Sam's assistants start out asleep or peaceful.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

Much like in SLASH'EM, there are [engravings](/wiki/Engraving "Engraving") in the corridor:

```
Pets are not allowed in the shop
Thieves will be killed.
Sorry about the mess. Remember, ask if you need help!
Don't even think about stealing anything.
```

The walls are undiggable and unphaseable. The level is no-teleport.

## One-eyed Sam

* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is a [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)").
* is female.
* is normally generated [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can pick up [magical items](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |                                                                                                            |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  | [SpliceHack 1.1.0 monst.c L3623](https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/src/monst.c#L3623) |

In SpliceHack, One-Eyed Sam is a special type of shopkeeper called an **Arms Dealer**. She is generated with [Thiefbane](/wiki/Thiefbane "Thiefbane"), [speed boots](/wiki/Speed_boots "Speed boots"), an [amulet of life saving](/wiki/Amulet_of_life_saving "Amulet of life saving"), some [gas grenades](/wiki/Gas_grenade "Gas grenade") and a [skeleton key](/wiki/Skeleton_key "Skeleton key"). Unlike in other variants, One-Eyed Sam is *not* resistant to death magic.

### Angering One-eyed Sam

If you anger Sam or her assistants, all of them will turn hostile.

Once Sam is angered, a group of soldiers will be summoned, and [iron bars](/wiki/Iron_bars "Iron bars") will drop from the ceiling in the corridor, next to the magic portal. The bars are raised once Sam is dead. If you are unable or unwilling to kill Sam, you can slip past the bars with the help of acid, phasing, or some polymorph forms.

## Strategy

Some of the advice provided for SLASH'EM's Black Market also applies to SpliceHack.

### Shopping

Be careful not to damage merchandise. Bring lots of gold and gems just in case something breaks. Don't eat [tins](/wiki/Tin "Tin") as you might drop your weapon. Don't incur [usage fees](/wiki/Usage_fee "Usage fee") by using items you have not paid for.

### Robbery

Unlike in SLASH'EM, you cannot [phase](/wiki/Phase "Phase") through the shop walls by any means.

Grabbing everything you want to steal, zapping Sam with a wand of teleporation, and running for the exit can still work. This will anger Sam and her assistants, and generate soldiers around the level. If they get in your way, you can zap the assistants and soldiers with teleport was well. When you reach the iron bars surrounding the magic portal, you can wield a potion of acid and use the [fight](/wiki/Fight "Fight") command (F) to dissolve the bars.

Having [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") is helpful in case a soldier zaps a [wand of death](/wiki/Wand_of_death "Wand of death") at you, and a [bag of holding](/wiki/Bag_of_holding "Bag of holding") can help you carry all the loot you want.

## See also

- [Black market (SLASH'EM)](/wiki/Black_market_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Black market (SLASH'EM)")
- [Black market (UnNetHack)](/wiki/Black_market_\(UnNetHack\) "Black market (UnNetHack)")

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) <https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/dat/dungeon.lua#L48>
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) <https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/dat/blkmar.lua>

Black market (SpliceHack)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The Black market in SpliceHack is similar to the black market in SLASH'EM. It offers many items for sale at inflated prices, and is guarded by One-Eyed Sam who is generated with Thiefbane. The magic portal to the black market is between levels 20 and 25.[1]

Contents

  • 1 Map
  • 2 One-eyed Sam
    • 2.1 Angering One-eyed Sam
  • 3 Strategy
    • 3.1 Shopping
    • 3.2 Robbery
  • 4 See also
  • 5 References

Map

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

The shop includes the entire level except the corridor on the left.

The assistants are the following ten monsters:

  • A rock troll named William
  • A rock troll named Thomas
  • A frost giant named Goliath
  • A wood nymph named Daphne
  • A balrog named Njalnohaar
  • A pit fiend named Hilvuuloth
  • A captain named Kidd
  • A marrashi named Kite
  • A salamander named Izzy

Sam's assistants start out asleep or peaceful.[2]

Much like in SLASH'EM, there are engravings in the corridor: 

Pets are not allowed in the shop
Thieves will be killed.
Sorry about the mess. Remember, ask if you need help!
Don't even think about stealing anything.

The walls are undiggable and unphaseable. The level is no-teleport.

One-eyed Sam

An Arms Dealer:

  • can fly.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is female.
  • is normally generated peaceful.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can pick up magical items.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference SpliceHack 1.1.0 monst.c L3623

In SpliceHack, One-Eyed Sam is a special type of shopkeeper called an Arms Dealer. She is generated with Thiefbane, speed boots, an amulet of life saving, some gas grenades and a skeleton key. Unlike in other variants, One-Eyed Sam is not resistant to death magic.

Angering One-eyed Sam

If you anger Sam or her assistants, all of them will turn hostile.

Once Sam is angered, a group of soldiers will be summoned, and iron bars will drop from the ceiling in the corridor, next to the magic portal. The bars are raised once Sam is dead. If you are unable or unwilling to kill Sam, you can slip past the bars with the help of acid, phasing, or some polymorph forms.

Strategy

Some of the advice provided for SLASH'EM's Black Market also applies to SpliceHack.

Shopping

Be careful not to damage merchandise. Bring lots of gold and gems just in case something breaks. Don't eat tins as you might drop your weapon. Don't incur usage fees by using items you have not paid for.

Robbery

Unlike in SLASH'EM, you cannot phase through the shop walls by any means.

Grabbing everything you want to steal, zapping Sam with a wand of teleporation, and running for the exit can still work. This will anger Sam and her assistants, and generate soldiers around the level. If they get in your way, you can zap the assistants and soldiers with teleport was well. When you reach the iron bars surrounding the magic portal, you can wield a potion of acid and use the fight command (F) to dissolve the bars.

Having reflection is helpful in case a soldier zaps a wand of death at you, and a bag of holding can help you carry all the loot you want.

See also

  • Black market (SLASH'EM)
  • Black market (UnNetHack)

  2. ↑ https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/dat/blkmar.lua
